job description:
Analytical Scientist – Method Validation

1+ Year Contract

The Scientist is responsible for stability assessment and validation activities associated with pre-commercialization drug product development projects. Specific activities include; execution of studies to evaluate the influence of a variety of environmental factors, such as temperature, humidity, and light, and execution protocols for analytical method validation. This position is laboratory based role, but will include generation of study reports.

Responsibilities:

  1. Responsible executing analytical method validation protocols
  2. Responsible for executing simulated environmental excursion studies.
  3. Accurately interprets, troubleshoots, and completes non-routine procedures when necessary.
  4. Responsible, in collaboration with management, to develop and achieve project timelines.
  5. Effectively communicate work activities both orally and in writing. Participate in cross departmental project teams as required.
  6. Document test data clearly and accurately. Maintain data integrity and ensure compliance with company policies, procedures, cGMPs, and regulatory requirements.

Qualifications:

  • B.S. / B.A. in chemistry or closely related field with 3 years, or more, of relevant hands-on experience in a GMP compliant pharmaceutical laboratory.
  • Must have experience in validation of chromatographic methods such as HPLC and GC
  • Must have understanding of laboratory instruments and methods for evaluation of pH, gravimetric analysis, assay by titration, assay by UV / Vis spectroscopy, and chromatographic assay / purity.
  • Ability to use software tools such MS Excel and MS Word to generate results and data.
  • Knowledge of Waters Empower Chromatography Data Software is desired.
